column5: ok, i have a new interest for the Salmon species, but i have 0 knowledge of them..... would someone care to educate me??  what kind of pole and reel would be best, what type of baits are common (not asking for secrets) a good time of year for fishing them (legally)  any info you can provide would be very educational to me as i know nothing.... thanks people...  i am also checking websites...
Here's a link to salmon fishing around Lake O.  http://spoonpullers.proboards42.com/index.cgi   Enjoy!
Thanks iceguy,thats the same link i was going to give as well i am a member of that site too,its a great lakes fishing site ,and alot of very good fisherman there ...cheers
does anyone know if the queenston boat launch is still accessible????

Yes Queenston is accessible, but you'll  have a 7 mile run out too the lake. You would be better off launching right on the lake. Either Jordan harbour,Port D (St.Catharines Game and Fish) or Port Weller Marina(east side of the canal.Good luck Rob
awesome, but i just want to shore fish  used to be a good location for many species of fish... i havnt fished there in many years, but would like to go n see ya know.... thanks Rob,

Sorry Bud I just assumed that you were looking for trolling info because it's that time of the year.You won't find any salmon in the river at this time of the year, their all out in the lake. Come late August depending on water temps the salmon would start showing up in the river. Rob
